thread.title: Boko Haram kills 'dozens' in NE Nigeria - locals
thread.title_full: Boko Haram kills 'dozens' in NE Nigeria - locals | News24

author: news24.com
title: Boko Haram kills 'dozens' in NE Nigeria - locals
text:
Kano - Boko Haram gunmen on horseback killed dozens of people in a village in northeast Nigeria's Borno state near the border with Cameroon, local eyewitnesses told AFP on Wednesday.
The incident took place on Monday morning in Fatawe village near Gwoza, where around 100 Boko Haram militants rounding up residents, tying their hands behind their backs then slitting their throats, they said.
"They killed several dozens but I can't give a precise number because we have yet to go back and take a headcount of the dead" said Amodu Kadir, a village resident who fled to Mubi village in neighbouring Adamawa state.
"The attackers who we have no doubt are Boko Haram gunmen came to the village around 10:30 and rounded up everyone including women and children after surrounding the village," he said.
